page.title: 07Our Blood Testing for Lead
page.content: We had to have our blood tested for lead because too much lead in the blood could affect the brain. Doctors are afraid that the health of children living near busy roads could suffer. First the nurse took a blood sample from our thumb. She smeared the blood onto a glass slide then put this slide into a special machine. This machine was able to measure the proportion of lead in the blood sample. The blood was normal if the count was 35 or less. If it was higher than this a further sample of veinous blood was taken from your arm and sent to the hospital for more tests. Pollution from car exhaust fumes is the main cause of the problem in our country today. We were chosen because our playground was found to have a high lead dust level in an earlier survey.
